ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken?
What is your overall assessment of this course?
Do you expect to use this class for credit toward your major, or toward a pre-professional program?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize ECON 110 05 for a fellow student? Would you recommend ECON 110 05 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Good class. Wish it were more of a seminar style. Problem sets were extremely difficult and time consuming, but overall, the work wasn't too bad.

this is a senior seminar in lecture style. The problem sets are extremely difficult, but the overall workload is acceptable. The final paper is on any topic related to finance and macroeconomics, and is an enjoyable way to explore your own interest.
I wouldn't - I wanted more of a seminar instead of a lecture class.
This is a very interesting class, but the problem sets are impossible. So, work in groups.
I wouldn't really recommend taking it unless the Professor makes some changes to the course (which I think he will). It's a good seminar for juniors, but seniors definitely have better choices.
Great course about the macroeconomic models explaining financial markets and panics. A must-take for people interested in financial policy-making.
If you are interested in the material.
Great class if you're interested in financial crisis, especially with regards to current events and there is no final which is always nice!

i definitely learned a lot from this class by doing my own presentation and paper because those were structured in a way to help you learn. however, the lectures honestly did not teach me a lot, except for certain basic concepts that were reitereated again and again- such as suspension of equiliberium, firesale, and some others.
Seminar. Clearly you need to take it for the major or else GTFO and RUN. PSETS = NO FUN.
